item.description:
I'm working my way up to a 5k run.  I'm not a runner, and I know nothing about running.  I haven't run at all this year.  So, yes, I'm a beginner.

 

But I've got to start somewhere!  If you'd like to join me and work up to a 5K (3 mile run) this summer, join me at Gaudet School as we take advantage of their wonderful track.

 

Don't worry if you're slow - I will be too!

Here are Adam's running times for every run he's done in 2011:

Monday (5/23) - 2 miles in less than 18 minutes (followed by 1 mile of untimed running)

Friday (5/27) - 2.5 miles in less than 22 minutes(followed by 1 mile of untimed running)

Monday (5/30) - 2.5 miles in less than 22 minutes

Friday (6/3) - 2.75 miles in less than 26 minutes

Monday (6/6) - 2.75 miles untimed

Friday (6/10) - 2.75 miles untimed

Monday (6/13) - 3 miles, 27 minutes 18 seconds

Wed (6/15) - 3 miles, 26 minutes 20 seconds

Fri (6/17) - 3 miles untimed

Sat (6/18) - 3 miles untimed

Mon (6/20) - 3 miles, 24 minutes 56 seconds

 

Here are Adam's lessons learned:

Minimize vertical distance moved

Stretch before and after

Practice sure helps!

It's easier to run with other people

 

Adam
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the guy with really short hair standing near the track entrance (behind the tennis court)
item.name: Slowly Working up to a 5K Run
